block.p: Suzanne Charlesworth Fowle, a daughter of Marcia and Bruce Fowle of New York, was married yesterday to Narain Schroeder, a son of Suzannah and Mark Schroeder of Belvidere, Vt. Richard Grossman, a nondenominational minister performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents in Sheffield, Mass.

The bride, 32, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a conservation biologist specializing in herpetology for the Massachusetts division of fisheries and wildlife in Belchertown, Mass. She graduated from Brown University and received a master's degree in wildlife biology from the University of Montana. Her father is a founding partner in Fox & Fowle Architects in New York. Her mother is a vice president of Civitas, a nonprofit planning organization in New York, and was the executive director of the New York City Audubon Society from 1993 to 1998.

Suzanne Charlesworth Fowle, a daughter of Marcia and Bruce Fowle of New York, was married yesterday to Narain Schroeder, a son of Suzannah and Mark Schroeder of Belvidere, Vt. Richard Grossman, a nondenominational minister performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents in Sheffield, Mass.

The bride, 32, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a conservation biologist specializing in herpetology for the Massachusetts division of fisheries and wildlife in Belchertown, Mass. She graduated from Brown University and received a master's degree in wildlife biology from the University of Montana. Her father is a founding partner in Fox & Fowle Architects in New York. Her mother is a vice president of Civitas, a nonprofit planning organization in New York, and was the executive director of the New York City Audubon Society from 1993 to 1998.

The bridegroom, 32, is a candidate for a master's degree in environmental studies at Antioch New England Graduate School in Keene, N.H., and a partner in Schroeder & Hickman Ventures, a real estate management company in Boulder, Colo. He graduated from the University of Colorado. His mother runs Cold Hollow Knitting, a hat and sweater manufacturer in Belvidere. His father is the treasurer of Sterling College in Craftsbury Common, Vt., and is a former treasurer of the Vermont Natural Resources Council.
